intro: Dalechampia crenulata, commonly known as the leafy hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Dalechampia crenulata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and vibrant blooms.
